articles.title: A Readerâ€™s Question on Nested Lists
articles.author: CSS-Tricks
articles.description: Exploring how to craft complex numbering systems using CSS list counters, with practical tips for nested lists and custom styles. A helpful guide for creating more sophisticated list structures in web design.

articles.title: How To Generate And Open HAR Files
articles.author: DebugBear
articles.description: HAR files capture all resources loaded during a website visit, making them invaluable for debugging performance issues and understanding resource loading behavior. Essential for web developers troubleshooting site problems.

description: Unlock the potential of CSS list counters to enhance your web design by creating complex and custom-styled numbering systems. Additionally, delve into the power of HAR files for comprehensive performance analysis and resource management, arming developers with the tools to optimize and troubleshoot their websites effectively.
joke: Why don't programmers like to gossip? They hate dealing with loose threads.
challenge: Create an interactive to-do list app using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript that allows users to add, edit, and delete tasks. Enhance it with a feature that automatically categorizes tasks based on user input and displays them in a visually appealing, nested structure using CSS counters. Bonus: Implement a simple performance analysis using the browser's developer tools to optimize the app's loading speed.
